member.name: T:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipPasswordCompatibilityMode
member.summary: Enumerates the password-compatibility modes for ASP.NET membership.

member.summary: Passwords are in ASP.NET 2.0 mode.

member.name: F:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipPasswordCompatibilityMode.Framework40
member.summary: Passwords are in ASP.NET 4 mode.

member.name: T:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus
member.summary: Describes the result of a operation.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.Success
member.summary: The user was successfully created.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.InvalidUserName
member.summary: The user name was not found in the database.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.InvalidPassword
member.summary: The password is not formatted correctly.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.InvalidQuestion
member.summary: The password question is not formatted correctly.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.InvalidAnswer
member.summary: The password answer is not formatted correctly.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.InvalidEmail
member.summary: The e-mail address is not formatted correctly.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.DuplicateUserName
member.summary: The user name already exists in the database for the application.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.DuplicateEmail
member.summary: The e-mail address already exists in the database for the application.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.UserRejected
member.summary: The user was not created, for a reason defined by the provider.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.InvalidProviderUserKey
member.summary: The provider user key is of an invalid type or format.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.DuplicateProviderUserKey
member.summary: The provider user key already exists in the database for the application.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus.ProviderError
member.summary: The provider returned an error that is not described by other enumeration values.

member.name: T:System.Web.Security.MembershipPasswordFormat
member.summary: Describes the encryption format for storing passwords for membership users.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipPasswordFormat.Clear
member.summary: Passwords are not encrypted.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipPasswordFormat.Hashed
member.summary: Passwords are encrypted one-way using the SHA1 hashing algorithm.

member.name: F:System.Web.Security.MembershipPasswordFormat.Encrypted
member.summary: Passwords are encrypted using the encryption settings determined by the machineKey Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema) element configuration.

member.name: T:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider
member.summary: Defines the contract that ASP.NET implements to provide role-management services using custom role providers.

member.name: M:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider.AddUsersToRoles(System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Adds the specified user names to the specified roles for the configured applicationName.
member.param: A string array of user names to be added to the specified roles.
A string array of the role names to add the specified user names to.

member.name: P:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application to store and retrieve role information for.
member.returns: The name of the application to store and retrieve role information for.

member.name: M:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider.CreateRole(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new role to the data source for the configured applicationName.
member.param: The name of the role to create.

member.name: M:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider.DeleteRole(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes a role from the data source for the configured applicationName.
member.returns: true if the role was successfully deleted; otherwise, false.
member.param: The name of the role to delete.
If true, throw an exception if has one or more members and do not delete .

member.name: M:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider.FindUsersInRole(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an array of user names in a role where the user name contains the specified user name to match.
member.returns: A string array containing the names of all the users where the user name matches and the user is a member of the specified role.
member.param: The role to search in.
The user name to search for.

member.name: M:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider.GetAllRoles
member.summary: Gets a list of all the roles for the configured applicationName.
member.returns: A string array containing the names of all the roles stored in the data source for the configured applicationName.

member.name: M:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider.GetRolesForUser(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a list of the roles that a specified user is in for the configured applicationName.
member.returns: A string array containing the names of all the roles that the specified user is in for the configured applicationName.
member.param: The user to return a list of roles for.

member.name: M:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider.GetUsersInRole(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a list of users in the specified role for the configured applicationName.
member.returns: A string array containing the names of all the users who are members of the specified role for the configured applicationName.
member.param: The name of the role to get the list of users for.

member.name: M:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider.IsUserInRole(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the specified user is in the specified role for the configured applicationName.
member.returns: true if the specified user is in the specified role for the configured applicationName; otherwise, false.
member.param: The user name to search for.
The role to search in.

member.summary: Removes the specified user names from the specified roles for the configured applicationName.

A string array of role names to remove the specified user names from.

member.name: M:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider.RoleExists(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the specified role name already exists in the role data source for the configured applicationName.
